newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar ends little changed, ranges tigh.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar ends little changed, ranges tigh.

text.p: LIFFE white sugar futures ended little changed in solid activity on Wednesday as steady selling pressure kept nearby values pinioned in tight ranges.
The March/May spread narrowed to 40 cents by the close, when March stood just 20 cents up at $298.00 and May down 10 cents at $297.60.
Volume amounted to a hefty 3,782 lots, boosted by against actuals trades and March/May crosses as the March expiry approaches.
"There haven't been any major trades at all...it's in a very tight range, very much like New York," said one trader.
"I don't think there's enough physical business going on to warrant the market moving much," he said.
Market sources said while March was well supported by trade buyers at around $295.00, gains were likely to be capped by mixed sellers around and just below $300.
